intro: Ipomoea texana, commonly known as the Texas morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a perennial vine that produces striking blue to purple flowers, typically blooming in the morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and can grow up to several meters in length. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in disturbed habitats. Its seeds are dispersed by animals and can remain viable in the soil for many years.
